titles: Certain queres, and the resolutions of the trayned-bonds, and citizens of London presented to the Honourable House of Commons.
publisher: August the 12th. 1645. by Leonard Lichfield, according to the copy printed last week at London,
notes: A compendium of facts and arguments on the Royalist side. The suppositions are suggestions of the real aims and position of those who pose on the Parliament side as acting on principle, with may puns on the adverbial termination--Madan.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
